info.document:
MEXICO CITY, Sept 15 (Reuters) - Storm Norma became a
hurricane on Friday evening as it barreled towards the
southernmost reaches of Mexico's Baja California peninsula, the
National Hurricane Center (NHC) said.
At 0300 GMT, Norma was 270 miles (435 km) south of Cabo San
Lucas and moving north north-west at 2 miles per hour (4 km/h),
the Miami-based NHC said. The Category 1 storm was blowing
maximum sustained winds of 75 mph (121 km/h), the center said.
Norma was expected to strengthen somewhat during the next
couple of days, the NHC said.
According to the NHC forecasts, Norma could hit southern
parts of Baja California near to its popular tourist resorts by
Monday, when it is projected to be weakening again.
(Reporting by Dave Graham; Editing by Tom Hogue)
